comment.author: 16911373@N04
comment._content: sculptor:  Solon Borglum, the less-famous, more-affable older brother of Gutzon Borglum.

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Wow!  Thanks for the information archscuplt.  While I was double-checking what you said, I came across the fact that there is a reproduction in Prescott, AZ's Town Square.  It would be pretty amazing to see this up close.

comment.author: 16911373@N04
comment._content: Hi OSU!... if that is your real name. Here you go, there's an up-close view of the Prescott version: www.flickr.com/photos/tombothetominator/3180502214/ And that makes two Solon Borglum equestrian bronzes on the grounds of the Yavapai County Court House. Here's the other one: www.flickr.com/photos/tom-margie/3733429842/ ...and I was wrong, Gutzon was older than Solon by a year. Solon was a sculptor first. Not sure which one of them was the better sculptor, but it's a sure thing that Gutzon was a superior publicist.

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Well, thanks again.  This kind of information is what we thrive off of.  Keep up the good work!

comment.author: 88802131@N08
comment._content: Is this Cowboy at Rest statue still on display in Portland Oregon?  And what is it's exact location if so?  Thanks

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Good question -- and one I wasn't able to find an answer to... Lots of great links on Wikipedia (see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solon_Borglum), maybe one of them will lead to a treasure map!

comment.author: 88802131@N08
comment._content: I don't think my reply posted...I have checked all my resources and nothing...somewhere I read that it was destroyed...but that was it...Smithsonian lists the owner as unknown.  Surely someon in Portland Ore. knows where the Cowboy at Rest is????  Who would I contact that would know?

comment.author: 88802131@N08
comment._content: hmmm at the top right side of the photo on this page...says photo was taken 2009...could you enlighten me on that????

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Hi velvetgirl2012- I would contact the Oregon Historical Society (ohs.org/) since they are the go to place for Oregon history. I'll correct the "date taken" -- Flickr's upload tool isn't ideal for historical images since the date defaults to the date scanned. In this case it was an oversight on our end. Tiah
